alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 7:19PM PST until January 01 at 8:15PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: .CHP has reported minor flooding on roadways in the southern San Joaquin Valley in Kern County due to moderate to heavy rainfall and poor drainage. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM PST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Arvin, Shafter, McFarland, Taft, Rosedale, Lamont, Weedpatch, Tupman, Dustin Acres, Valley Acres, Ford City, South Taft, Taft Heights, Oildale, Edison, Famoso, Harris Ranch, Buttonwillow and Bear Valley Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
